1.title: The Merchants of Venice
1.plot: Stephen Baldwin has a plan: to start a conversation with everyday Americans about what America means to them. Joining forces with his good friend, Max Keiser, they embark on a pilgrimage to do just that by grabbing Stephen's dogs, gassing up.

2.title: Southern Boarders
2.plot: Stephen and Max finally get out of California and head to Baldwin's former home: Arizona. Stopping at the 'Best Pizza in Arizona', they meet an immigrant couple who achieved the American Dream. Stephen tries his hands in the kitchen while Max brushes up on his French as they discuss the trials and tribulations of immigrating to America as well as the policies surrounding it.

3.title: Rise Like a Phoenix Part Deux
3.plot: Loving the desert weather, Stephen and Max stick around Arizona another day. Stephen sits down with a self-converted Muslim American woman who is running for the US Senate, while Max dresses up as Abraham Lincoln to meet local college students and continue the conversation about America, immigration and a border wall. Our heroes also discover a problem with the RV that needs a quick remedy.

4.title: Lone Star State of Mind
4.plot: Stephen and Max travel to Corpus Cristi to attend the "Best of the Best Southwest" conference where Stephen was invited to be a guest speaker and to meet local business owners to talk about the local economy and see how they're dealing with the aftermath of Hurricane Harvey. Then they sit down to talk with Danny who works in crypto-currency and helped the local hurricane victims escape the flooding.

5.title: Lone Star State of Mind Part 2
5.plot:
Know what this is about?
 Be the first one to add a plot.

7.title: High Plains Shifter -- Standing Rock, ND
7.plot: Stephen and Max leave Mount Rushmore, traveling through the Black Hills and across the great plains to visit another monument for a great American- the Standing Bull Memorial in North Dakota. As Max hits the road to film more Keiser Reports, Stephen goes hog wild on a motorcycle ride with Rio and a local woman who takes him to meet Councilman Dave, the former leader of the Standing Rock Tribe in North Dakota.

8.title: High Plains Shifter, Part 2 -- Standing Rock, ND
8.plot: Councilman Dave takes Stephen on a tour in the RV, teaching our hero about the recent protests, the history of the local Sioux tribes, and the importance of the land and the buffalo to the people in the Dakotas.

9.title: South Side With Me -- Chicago, IL
9.plot: Stephen arrives in the Windy City with Rio and realizes they're both in need of haircuts. So our hero sends Rio to the doggy spa while he goes to a south side barbershop to get cleaned up and talk to the owner Sunni and other regulars in the shop about their neighborhood, politics and America's future.

10.title: Deep Dishing -- Chicago, IL
10.plot: Stephen and his new co-pilot Rio enjoy their 2nd day in the Windy City, navigating the streets, sight-seeing and talking to people about the Chicago way and what America means to them. Stephen then meets up with an old friend to get a taste of Chicago before re-joining Max.

11.title: Slowing Down to go Fast -- Chicago, IL
11.plot: Stephen and Max hit the road on their third day in Chicago, driving straight through to the Bay State while discussing music, 'Free RV Day' and bad political references. Once in Massachusetts, Max tries being a short order cook while Stephen sits down to talk politics with a young woman running for local office - if only he can remember where he is.

12.title: New England Patriot -- Westminister, MA
12.plot: Stephen heads to a quaint New England town to sit down and talk with Bruce, a local Vietnam veteran who battled cancer he got from being exposed to Agent Orange during his tour of duty. While there, Stephen happens upon a group of other veterans who are there, raising money for their charity.

13.title: Boston Strong -- Boston, MA
13.plot: Stephen and Max finally make it to the birthplace of America-Boston, MA where Stephen is inspired with a genius idea. Max hits the streets near Harvard University to talk America and what it means to be 'Boston Strong' while Stephen sits down with a local nurse who was at the finish line the day of the Boston Marathon bombing.

14.title: Plymouth Rock n' Rolls
14.plot: Stephen and Max call on the help of Dash to be the Top Gun donators to a local veteran charity and try to get help with Stephen's genius idea of putting the RV on a barge out in the Boston Harbor. They then head to 'Plimoth Plantation', a living history museum, to talk to some local Pilgrims and see how much the country has changed since they first arrived on Plymouth Rock.

15.title: Pahk the Cah -- Boston Harbor
15.plot: Stephen insists he plans to finish the pilgrimage by putting the RV on a barge, sailing it out into the Boston Harbor and having a Boston Tea Party. He also looks back on each hurdle along the way to reflect on the pilgrimage.

16.title: Pilgrimage Theater
16.plot: With the pilgrimage complete, Stephen revisits his experiences on the journey, and does his best to remember all the ports of call while answering viewers' questions.

-1.title: Just Face It
-1.plot: Stephen and Max make their way to South Dakota to bask in the glory of Mount Rushmore and then talk to local business owners in the nearby town of Keystone- A wood carver who makes sculptures with his chainsaw and an immigrant who sells patriotic T-shirts. Max gets a lesson in the art of chainsaw carving and "Abraham Lincoln" makes a special appearance in town as well.

imdb.title: The Great American Pilgrimage
plot: a new series taking a look at the varying definitions of what it means to be an American.
